## Q2 — Z Confidence Interval (Lower Bound) {#q2}
Using the dataset `Academic_Performance_B.csv`, consider the variable `Exam_Score`. Assume the population standard deviation is σ=12. Construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true mean exam score. 
What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
n <- ___
sigma <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
n <- length(x)
sigma <- 12
z <- qnorm(0.975)
xbar - z*sigma/sqrt(n)
# 73.9409
```
## Q3 — Z Confidence Interval (Upper Bound) {#q3}
Using the dataset `Academic_Performance_B.csv`, consider the variable `Exam_Score`. Assume the population standard deviation is σ=12. Construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true mean exam score. 
What is the upper bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
n <- ___
sigma <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false

x <- df$Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
n <- length(x)
sigma <- 12

xbar + z*sigma/sqrt(n)
# 84.4591
```
## Q4 — t Critical Value {#q4}
Using the dataset `Academic_Performance_A.csv` (n = 20), what is the 95% two-sided t* critical value?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
n <- length(df$Final_Exam_Score)

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
n <- length(df$Final_Exam_Score)
qt(0.975, df = n - 1)
# 2.0930
```
## Q5 — t Confidence Interval (Lower Bound) {#q5}
Using the dataset `Academic_Performance_B.csv` (n = 20), construct a 95% t confidence interval for the true mean final exam score. Assume the population variance is unknown. 
What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Final_Exam_Score
xbar <- ___
s <- ___
n <- ___
tstar <- ___
```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Final_Exam_Score
xbar <- mean(x)
s <- sd(x)
n <- length(x)
tstar <- qt(0.975, df = n - 1)
xbar - tstar*s/sqrt(n)
# 71.6810
```

## Q7 — Proportion CI (Lower Bound){#q7}
Using the dataset `Academic_Performance_B.csv`, construct a 95% Z confidence interval for the true admission proportion.
What is the lower bound of this interval?
```{webr}
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Admitted
n <- ___
phat <- ___
z <- ___

```

```{webr}
#| echo: false
#| output: false
df <- read.csv("Academic_Performance_B.csv")
x <- df$Admitted
n <- length(x)
phat <- mean(x)
z <- qnorm(0.975)
phat - z*sqrt(phat*(1-phat)/n)
# 0.2809
```
